import pandas as pd

#read the parquet file from our staging folder
df_raw = spark.read.parquet(
    "abfss://group3fpfilesystem@group3fpadls.dfs.core.windows.net/staging/population.parquet/"
)

#convert to a pandas df
df = df_raw.toPandas()
#Create columns for the df
df_long = df[['TIME_PERIOD', 'REF_AREA', 'SEX', 'POPULATION']]

#Change column names to our standardized names
df_long = df_long.rename(columns={
    'TIME_PERIOD': 'year', 
    'REF_AREA': 'country', 
    'SEX':'sex', 
    'POPULATION': 'population'
})

# Define custom order for 'sex' so M comes before F, and only keep M and F not _T(total)
df_long['sex'] = pd.Categorical(df_long['sex'], categories=['M', 'F'], ordered=True)

#sort based on time period,country and gender
df_long = df_long.sort_values(by=['year', 'country', 'sex']).reset_index(drop=True)


# Remove rows where sex is NaN, which was originally _T, but i didnt put it in categories so its now NaN
df_long = df_long.dropna(subset=['sex']).reset_index(drop=True)
df_long = df_long.reset_index(drop=True)
df_long.head(100)

#convert into spark df and store in our standardized folder
spark_df = spark.createDataFrame(df_long)
output_path = "abfss://group3fpfilesystem@group3fpadls.dfs.core.windows.net/standardized/population.parquet"
spark_df.write.mode("overwrite").parquet(output_path)
